intro: Sida patula, commonly known as slender sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pink to purple, with five petals, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. Sida patula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
